subject: Re: [junit] Parameterized Test Case example
msgSnippet: ... Right. The only difference is that I m letting JUnit play the role of failure collector, since that s what it was designed for. :) :) -- J. B.
messageBody:
<snip />
> Along the same lines, I have had occasion to use the same single test
> method technique with an externalize data file, but allowing for
> multiple failures to be accumulated. While looping through the "rows"
> of data, the test method catches AssertionFailedError and adds it to a
> collection of failures. When the test suite completes, it dumps out
> any failures that were collected along the way.

Right. The only difference is that I'm letting JUnit play the role of
"failure collector," since that's what it was designed for. :) :)
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
